instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00840: What is 820-00840? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message:
got this macbook , light water damage, ppbus 0ohm to ground , then i insert 1v, 2 amp,  and alcohol allover,  i notice <CHIP>U7220</CHIP> getting really hot, ( it use ppbus )

IS  MY CPU DEAD already 

is <CHIP>U7220</CHIP> shot to ground or some mosfate or caps?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message:
Pray you didn't kill it injecting voltage without checking for such sorted MOSFETs first.
So many times explained how to deal with short on <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>...
1Vshouldn't damage CPU, but is no reason to do that in such way.

Post exact ohm value (not diode mode) to ground on <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> and compare that value with the readings on ALL big coils.
If you get the same value on any, remove corresponding high-side MOSFET and check if <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> goes high.
If yes, you've just found the culprit.
